title: Meatball Cannoli - Meatball Rolls
directions: Set Oven to 350 Degrees and line a baking sheet with Parchment paper.

Take out Biscuits and flatten out so their just large enough to hold three meatballs with edges to crimp and there is a bit of dough at each end past the outer meatballs. (Doing one at a time makes things go easy!)

Spoon sauce to cover the center of the dough disk leaving the edges that will be crimped as clean as possible. Cover sauce with cheese. (Think of those cheap school pizzas that had just enough sauce and cheese to be semi edible)

Top each sauced/cheesed disk with 3 meatballs, then add a little bit of sauce and cheese over the meatballs. Bring the two clean edges and pinch/crimp together as best you can. Then sprinkle on a bit more of the cheese over top.
While the Rolls are baking melt your Butter, add the Garlic Powder and Parsley to melted butter and mix.
Once the rolls are golden brown and cheese is melted, remove from oven and brush over the butter topping.
ingredients: 1 – 1 ½ Cups Marinara Sauce (I just got a Jar of a type I liked!)
